name: AGILE
goals: Study the most energetic phenomena in the Universe

name: Gamma-ray Burst polarimeter (GPA)
goals: Measure the polarization of gamma-ray bursts

name: XMM-Newton
goals: Observe X-ray sources, providing insights into the Universe

name: NuStar
goals: Study black holes, supernovae, and other high-energy objects

name: AstroSat
goals: Multi-wavelength observations of the universe

name: Neutron Star Interior Composition Explorer (NICER)
goals: Study the physics of neutron stars

name: Hard X-ray Modulation Telescope (HXMT)
goals: Observe black holes and neutron stars

name: Spektr-RG
goals: Map the X-ray sky

name: IXPE
goals: Measure the polarization of X-rays from black holes and neutron stars

name: Interface Region Imaging Spectrograph (IRIS)
goals: Study the solar interface region

name: Hisaki (SPRINT-A)
goals: Observe exospheres of planets

name: Near Earth Object Surveillance Satellite (NEOSSat)
goals: Detect and track near-Earth objects

name: Hubble
goals: Study the universe at large

name: Chandra X-ray
goals: Study high-energy phenomena

name: Fermi Gamma-ray
goals: Study the most energetic phenomena in the universe

name: Swift Gamma Ray
goals: Observe gamma-ray bursts and afterglows

name: INTEGRAL
goals: Observe high-energy cosmic sources

name: Gaia
goals: Create a 3D map of the Milky Way

name: STEREO
goals: Provide stereoscopic images of the Sun and study coronal mass ejections

name: TESS
goals: Discover exoplanets around nearby stars

name: CHEOPS
goals: Characterize exoplanets

name: WISE (Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer)
goals: Survey the sky in infrared light

name: Odin
target: Interstellar gas and dust, planetary atmospheres
goals: Study the chemical composition of the universe

name: Interstellar Boundary Explorer (IBEX)
goals: Map the boundary between our solar system and interstellar space

name: Alpha Magnetic Spectrometer (AMS-02)
goals: Study cosmic rays in search of dark matter and antimatter

name: Dark Matter Particle Explorer (DAMPE)
goals: Search for dark matter by detecting high-energy particles in space

name: Aditya L1
goals: Study the Sunâ€™s corona, chromosphere, and photosphere

name: Euclid
goals: Study dark matter and dark energy

name: GALEX
goals: Study the history of star formation in the universe

name: COROT
goals: Search for exoplanets and study stellar oscillations

name: Solar & Heliospheric Observatory
goals: Study the Sun, from its interior to its outer atmosphere and the solar wind
